alert.note: Alert for Anson; Hoke; Richmond; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 7:57PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Anson, Hoke, Richmond and Scotland. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 756 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Laurinburg, Rockingham, Wadesboro, Raeford, Hamlet, Hoffman, Polkton, Ellerbe, Dobbins Heights, Wagram, Lilesville, Morven, Peachland, McFarlan, East Rockingham, Diggs, Blewett Falls Lake, Sandhills Game Land, Laurel Hill and Camp Mackall.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
